alert.note: Alert for Eastern Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 05 at 4:45AM AKST until January 06 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 45 to 65 mph with gusts up to 90 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians, including Unalaska and Nikolski. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A rapidly intensifying storm system will track from the North Pacific into the southern Bering Sea tonight through Saturday. While the storm is trending faster and its track has shifted eastward, there continues to be good potential for high winds across the Eastern Aleutian Islands.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
